title: How can computers understand what we are saying? - Quora

response.answer_text: Google and other companies are trying to reach this goal in a relatively short term (3 - 5 years) using the World Wide Web and other data sources to train very large, very complex AI systems. This would probably give us a first, usable system that will give us the “illusion” of a real conversation. The current (very fine) version of Google Assistant can give you an idea of the possible results. To have a REAL understanding of human communication, we will have to wait a lot longer, probably 30 to 50 years, maybe even 70 to 100. This because you cannot have real understanding without a real “mind”.

I cannot say for sure… but all those information are translated into machine language of millions or even more bits of information in zeroes and ones… even a letter has a specific code in BCD code of 6 specific combination of 0’s and 1’s…. So all the information being fed to a computer has been converted into machine language by an interpreter program made by a manufacturer or programmer.
